intro: Critoniopsis magdalenae, commonly known as the Magdalena orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant has a compact growth habit with short, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes, often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
